info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 15 at 6:06AM EST until January 18 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy lake effect snow. Additional snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches in the most persistent lake snows. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy lake effect snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 16 inches possible in the most persistent lake snows. * WHERE...Northern Erie county. For today, most persistent snows will be in northeastern parts of the county, including the city of Buffalo and Tonawanda. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 1 PM EST this afternoon. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Tuesday morning through Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult in bands of heavy lake effect snow. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute.
info.instruction: Heavy snow will fall in relatively narrow bands. If traveling, be prepared for rapidly changing road conditions and visibilities. Submit snow reports through our website or social media. Narrow bands of heavy snow could impact portions of the region. Localized travel problems will be possible.
